citeinfo.origin: REQUIRED: The name of an organization or individual that developed the data set.
citeinfo.pubdate: REQUIRED: The date when the data set is published or otherwise made available for release.
citeinfo.title: neighborhoods_orleans

idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows XP Version 5.1 (Build 2600) Service Pack 2; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.1.0.722

descript.abstract:
In a 1980 study by New Orleans City Planning, 68 neighborhoods were designated for Orleans Parish. City Planning continues to use these geographic designations to understand and plan for the City. After each Census, City Planning has made adjustments to the neighborhoods based on changes in Census tract boundaries. As of October 2001, according to documents we received from City Planning, City Planning has 76 neighborhood designations. The New Orleans City Planning Commission has further compiled these neighborhoods to form 13 planning districts.
As the GNO Community Data Center started its work with developing publicly available data at a sub-parish level, we started with these neighborhood designations (based on documents we received from NO City Planning in October 2001) and made some minor adaptations as noted:
1) The Warehouse District is considered its own neighborhood by City Planning, but since it is part of a larger Census tract found in Planning District 2's Lower Garden District neighborhood, we have included it in the Lower Garden District rather than as a distinct neighborhood in District 1.
2) In New Orleans East, we collapsed three neighborhoods in the Lake Catherine area into one, called Lake Catherine neighborhood, because the City Planning designations split the Census tract comprising that area.
3) On the West bank, we have included New Aurora with English Turn in Planning District 13 in order to be consistent with neighborhood boundaries used in a 1998 Health Assets Survey. City Planning includes New Aurora in District 12.
4) With housing developments, we have followed the City Planning neighborhoods from October 2001, although in recent zoning discussions, some of these developments that technically are part of larger neighborhoods had separate community discussions.
descript.purpose: The boundaries on this web site are used for the organization and presentation of data.
